forecast.name: Thanksgiving Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a high near 47. East wind 7 to 10 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Chance Light Rain then Mostly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 10pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 34. West wind 7 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Boston today, the skies hang heavy, draped in a shroud of grey, setting a tone that is at once somber and contemplative. Rain is a constant companion, falling steadily as if to wash the city in gentle reflection. Temperatures hover near the mid-forties, with a brisk east wind nudging through, urging the clouds to linger just a little longer. Those venturing outside will want to don layers, perhaps a warm wool sweater beneath a waterproof jacket, a cozy scarf wrapped snugly around the neck, and a sturdy umbrella at the ready, for the chill bites more fiercely when the dampness settles in.

As the day drifts toward evening, the chance of rain diminishes slightly, allowing a brief pause in the downpour, yet the clouds remain steadfast. This is a day where the warmth of a café with a good book or the rhythmic clinks of a warm kitchen might beckon one indoors. One might stroll along narrow streets, cloaked in an air of mystery and contemplation, and if so inclined, pause for a moment under an awning, watching the rain dance on the pavement, listening to the murmurs of the city while the world blends into soft silhouettes in the distance. The mood is pensive, but therein lies a unique beauty—a day where stillness reigns supreme amidst the shifting of the elements.
